title: Tory Lanez sentenced to 10 years for shooting Megan Thee Stallion in the foot
description: Canadian rapper Tory Lanez was sentenced to 10 years after he was found guilty of shooting hip-hop superstar Megan Thee Stallion in the foot after the pair left a Los Angeles party in 2020.

title: Trump says a protective order violates his First Amendment rights: 'I will talk'
description: Donald Trump on Tuesday vowed that he "will talk" about the criminal charges he faces because of his efforts to overturn the 2020 election.

title: U.K. election regulator says hackers had access for over a year but elections still secure
description: Hackers gained access to the U.K.’s election regulator, the Electoral Commission, for more than a year, the agency said Tuesday.

title: Trump election grand jury back at work in federal courthouse
description: The federal grand jury that returned an indictment against former President Donald Trump last week was meeting again in the Washington, D.C. courthouse Tuesday.

title: First Lizzo concert since lawsuit was filed against her is canceled
description: The Made In America Festival — a two-day music event which artists Lizzo and Sza were scheduled to headline in September — has been canceled.

title: Three men charged with assault in Montgomery riverfront brawl
description: Three men are facing misdemeanor assault charges after a group of white men attacked a Black dock worker during a brawl in Montgomery, Alabama, on Saturday.

title: Suspect in Oregon cinderblock cell kidnapping targeted sex workers in prior crimes, FBI believes
description: The man accused of kidnapping and sexually assaulting a sex worker in Oregon is believed to have targeted sex workers in prior crimes, the FBI said Monday.

title: Supreme Court allows Biden ‘ghost gun’ regulations
description: The Supreme Court will allow the Biden administration to regulate so-called "ghost guns,"  firearm-making kits available online that people can assemble at home

title: Trump and conservative media stars celebrate U.S. losing at World Cup
description: Conservative media stars and personalities — including former President Donald Trump — are celebrating after the U.S. women's national soccer team lost to Sweden in the round of 16 on Sunday.

title: Banks hit with $549 million in fines for use of Signal and WhatsApp to evade regulators
description: U.S. regulators on Tuesday announced a combined $549 million in penalties against Wells Fargo and a raft of smaller or non-U.S.

title: Dallas doctor with end-stage breast cancer receives musical support
description: After being diagnosed with stage 4 breast cancer, a Dallas doctor with a passion for music received an outpouring from social media with bands and artists lining up to support her. NBC News' Jay Gray reports.

title: Ron DeSantis replaces his campaign manager as he reboots his presidential bid
description: Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis is shaking up his campaign leadership, bringing in James Uthmeier, his longtime chief of staff, as his new presidential campaign manager.

title: Weight-loss drug Wegovy cuts risk of stroke and heart attacks, the drugmaker says
description: The blockbuster obesity drug Wegovy cuts the risk of cardiovascular events, such as heart attack and stroke, by 20%, drugmaker Novo Nordisk said Tuesday.

title: Florida district bars trans teachers from using preferred pronouns and bathrooms to comply with state law
description: The Orange County Public Schools guidance was issued Monday to follow two Florida laws signed by Gov. Ron DeSantis that took effect in July, impacting gender identity and bathroom usage in state schools.

title: Florida school board reverses decision nixing access to children's book about a male penguin couple
description: “And Tango Makes Three” recounts the true story of two male penguins who were devoted to each other at the Central Park Zoo in New York.

title: Ex-Trump lawyer John Eastman seeks to postpone his disbarment proceedings
description: Lawyer John Eastman is asking to postpone disbarment proceedings over concerns that he could face criminal charges related to the latest Trump indictment.

title: Georgia kids would need parental permission to join social media if Senate Republicans get their way
description: Georgia could join other states requiring children to have their parents’ explicit permission to create social media accounts.

title: Ohio ballot election sets the stage for a major abortion fight in November
description: Ohioans head to the polls Tuesday to decide whether to make it more difficult to pass ballot measures in the state.

title: Extreme weather in the South and Wayne Brady comes out as pansexual: Morning Rundown
description: Montgomery brawl, Wayne Brady pansexual, Sandra Bullock partner, East Coast weather, Operation Bakis, Australia pedophile ring, Mega Millions, New York shark attack

title: Joe Biden’s brand is being tested like never before
description: Controversies centered around President Joe Biden's family have become fodder for GOP attacks that cut at the bedrock of his longtime political appeal.

title: Woman critical after shark attack at popular New York City beach
description: A woman was in critical condition following a shark attack Monday off Rockaway Beach, one of the New York City's most popular Atlantic coast attractions, authorities said.

title: Zoom addresses privacy concerns raised by AI data collection language in terms of service
description: On Monday, Zoom issued a statement saying that it would not use anyone's data for AI training without consent. The controversy is the latest scuffle over AI.
